Description: Bowl sherd of Chian, possibly black-figured, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; in centre, rosette with eight petals alternating added red and white; pair of white circles around rosette and another pair further out; exterior: four brownish black bands evenly spaced.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs to a Black Figure chalice, however, there is no evidence for black-figure decoration on the sherd. The exterior and interior decorations are similar however to those of a black-figure chalice from Chios, Lemos pl. 196, no.1488. The decoration on both sides is also consistent with the earlier Mature Animal Style
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 328, no. 1527)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1267) (phase 2)
